page.title: 16Local Government
page.content: The Parish Council now have little power & act mainly as channels of communication with larger authorities. They can however have an effect on the local environment in terms of the upkeep of footpaths, streetlighting, hedge cutting, vandalism, bus time- tables, sewers & flooding. In certain circumstances, the Parish Council can be highly effective, eg in organising the planting of 120 trees to replace dead elms. There is no gas in the area, but other services come from a variety of sources - education & roads from Herts CC; police, planning & refuse collection from E Herts DC; water from Lee Valley Authority; electricity from Eastern Electricity in Ipswich & telephones from Bedford. Most people do not seem dissatisfied over adequacy of services & mobile library particularly appreciated.
